content.description: up the hill from urban escape. 3 pitches. A couple of large cams could be used on the first pitch which climbs the obvious right facing corner.  Pitch two is the easiest and the most fun. The third pitch is the crux and is at this time has a lot of loose rock. Bring a helmet. You can rap the route with one rope.
content.protection: 2nd and 3rd pitch have lots of bolts. On pitch one a couple of large cams are optional
content.location: Cut off from the trail that leads up to Pusch Peak just before you start scrambling up rock. There is a small cairn on the right as well.

content.protection: 14 quickdraws will get you to the top. Bring one long sling for the second bolt on the 2nd pitch or clean it after you clip the 3rd bolt.
content.location: Follow the linda vista trail towards Pusch peak. When the trail is 20 feet from the rock and next to a smooth slab you are at the base of Sent to the Office. 35 minutes

content.description: Clips first bolt of "Sent to the Office"
content.location: In between "Sent to the Office" and "Heirarchy of Needs" Ends at 2 bolt belay of Heirarchy of Needs. One rope rap to the ground

content.description: From the top of the second pitch of urban escape move right to a belay below the obvious huge left facing corner. Climb up to this clipping bolts. Climb the corner to a bolt and escape right or climb straigt up past the yet to be placed bolts to chain
content.protection: bolts. Rack of camalots to a #4
content.location: This route like the others is in the shade in the afternoon.

content.description: Fun small roof. A great setting climbing a beautiful arete on the first pitch
content.protection: light rack. Mostly bolts. Can wrap with one rope
content.location: The arete to the right of "Sent to the office"   Start atop a larg pinnacle and clip a bolt on the main face before stepping across

content.description: i put up Sent to the office years ago. I named if after I got down and my daughter had been sent to the office. Less bold and less ego driven I recently went back and rebolted Sent to the office. It goes with a rack of quickdraws, one rope,and is just as fun but less serious now (for me more fun). The wall is north facing with lots of shade. Short approach for this side of the Catalinas. Feels like the back country. A helmet is highly recommended. Bring a set of cams up to #4 Camelot if you want to do the big corner. More bolts on the other routes coming soon.
